greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table read by antidiagonals where A(n,k) is the number of n X k aperiodic binary arrays.
comment: An n X k matrix is aperiodic if all n * k rotations of its sequence of rows and its sequence of columns are distinct.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
example: Note that the following are not aperiodic even though their row and column sequences are independently aperiodic:
program: for n in [1..8] do for k in [1..8] do Print(n*k*A323861(n,k), ", "); od; Print("\n"); od; # _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 21 2019
xref: First and last columns are A027375. Main diagonal is A323863.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Feb 04 2019
ext: Terms a(29) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 21 2019
